adaptation_measure.name: Adaptation Measure
adaptation_measure.description: Planned or implemented actions to adjust to actual or expected climate and its effects, ranging from incremental improvements to transformational change.

green_roof.name: Green Roof
green_roof.description: A vegetated layer installed on building rooftops that provides cooling, stormwater retention, and ecological benefits.

rain_garden.name: Rain Garden
rain_garden.description: A shallow, planted depression designed to capture and absorb stormwater runoff, reducing flooding and improving water quality.

urban_forest.name: Urban Forest
urban_forest.description: A network of trees and green spaces within urban areas that provides shade, cooling, biodiversity, and improved air quality

wetland_restoration.name: Wetland Restoration
wetland_restoration.description: The process of rehabilitating degraded wetlands to recover their ecological functions, such as water filtration, flood mitigation, and habitat provision.

permeable_surfaces.name: Permeable surfaces
permeable_surfaces.description: Surfaces that allow water infiltration to reduce runoff.

blue_green_infrastructure.name: Blue-Green Infrastructure
blue_green_infrastructure.description: Integrated network of natural and semi-natural green and blue elements that provide ecosystem services such as flood regulation, cooling and water management.

flood_barrier.name: Flood Barrier
flood_barrier.description: A physical structure designed to prevent or reduce the intrusion of floodwaters into vulnerable areas.

drainage_system.name: Drainage System
drainage_system.description: An engineered network that collects and channels excess water away from urban or natural areas to prevent flooding.

building_retrofitting.name: Building retrofitting
building_retrofitting.description: Structural modification of buildings to reduce climate risks.

cool_roof.name: Cool Roof
cool_roof.description: A roofing system made of reflective or high‑emissivity materials that reduces heat absorption and lowers indoor temperatures.

microgrid.name: Microgrid
microgrid.description: Localized energy system capable of operating independently from the main grid to enhance energy resilience during disruptions.

early_warning_system.name: Early Warning System
early_warning_system.description: Systems for forecasting and communicating climate-related risks.

flood_forecasting.name: Flood Forecasting
flood_forecasting.description: Systems and models used to predict flood events and their potential magnitude to support early warning and preparedness.

emergency_planning.name: Emergency planning
emergency_planning.description: Preparedness and response planning for climate hazards.

evacuation_planning.name: Evacuation Planning
evacuation_planning.description: Preparedness planning for the organized relocation of populations from areas at risk due to imminent climate hazards.

climate_smart_agriculture.name: Climate-smart agriculture
climate_smart_agriculture.description: Strategic approach to transform agricultural systems to enhance resilience, support food security and address climate change adaptation.

water_management.name: Water management
water_management.description: Operational measures to manage water resources under climate stress.

stormwater_management.name: Stormwater Management
stormwater_management.description: Management practices and systems designed to control runoff, reduce flooding and improve water quality during rainfall events.

heat_health_action_plan.name: Heat health action plan
heat_health_action_plan.description: Operational plans to reduce health impacts during heat waves.

policy_and_planning.name: Policy and planning
policy_and_planning.description: Policies, plans and regulatory instruments supporting climate adaptation.

governance_and_institutional_capacity.name: Governance and institutional capacity
governance_and_institutional_capacity.description: Institutional arrangements and governance mechanisms for adaptation.

capacity_building.name: Capacity building
capacity_building.description: Activities aimed at strengthening skills, knowledge and capacities for adaptation.

monitoring_and_data_systems.name: Monitoring and data systems
monitoring_and_data_systems.description: Systems for monitoring climate risks and adaptation performance.

climate_hazard.name: Climate Hazard
climate_hazard.description: A climate‑related danger arising from atmospheric or environmental processes that can negatively affect human or natural systems.

flood.name: Flood
flood.description: An abnormal accumulation or overflow of water that inundates land which is normally dry.

coastal_flood.name: Coastal Flood
coastal_flood.description: Flooding in coastal zones caused by extreme tides, storm surges, waves, or temporary sea‑level increases.

river_flood.name: River Flood
river_flood.description: Overflow of rivers or streams due to heavy rainfall, snowmelt, or saturated soils.

urban_flood.name: Urban Flood
urban_flood.description: Localized flooding in urban areas triggered by intense rainfall, inadequate drainage, or highly impermeable surfaces.

drought.name: Drought
drought.description: A prolonged period of abnormally low water availability relative to the typical supply for a given region and time period.

heat_wave.name: Heat Wave
heat_wave.description: A sustained period of abnormally high atmospheric temperatures relative to the climatological average for a given location and time of year.

urban_heat_island.name: Urban Heat Island
urban_heat_island.description: A localized climatic phenomenon characterized by significantly higher air temperatures in an urban area compared to its surrounding rural areas, primarily caused by the modification of land surfaces and human activities.

sea_level_rise.name: Sea Level Rise
sea_level_rise.description: A long-term and gradual increase in the average global or regional sea level, primarily driven by thermal expansion of ocean water and the melting of land-based ice due to anthropogenic global warming.

storm.name: Storm
storm.description: A disturbed state of the atmosphere characterized by strong winds, and often accompanied by heavy precipitation, thunder, lightning, or other severe phenomena.

hurricane.name: Hurricane
hurricane.description: A powerful tropical storm characterized by strong winds, heavy rainfall and storm surges, capable of causing widespread damage.

wildfire.name: Wildfire
wildfire.description: An uncontrolled and freely spreading fire burning predominantly in natural vegetation (e.g., forests, grasslands, scrublands) or on peatlands.

sector.name: Sector
sector.description: Thematic domain representing areas of activity, systems or environments referenced in climate-related knowledge.

urban_system.name: Urban system
urban_system.description: Integrated socio-ecological and socio-technical system encompassing population, infrastructure, services and ecosystems in urban areas.

urban_services.name: Urban services
urban_services.description: Essential public services provided in urban areas, including water, energy, transport and healthcare.

agriculture_and_food.name: Agriculture and food
agriculture_and_food.description: Agricultural production, farming activities and food systems.

water.name: Water
water.description: Water resources, supply, management and hydrological systems.

water_resources.name: Water resources
water_resources.description: Natural freshwater resources including surface water and groundwater.

public_health.name: Public health
public_health.description: Population-level health systems focused on prevention, surveillance and health promotion.

healthcare_systems.name: Healthcare systems
healthcare_systems.description: Systems providing medical care, treatment and health services to individuals and communities.

energy.name: Energy
energy.description: Energy production, transmission, distribution and supply systems.

electricity_systems.name: Electricity systems
electricity_systems.description: Systems for electricity generation, transmission and distribution.

infrastructure_and_networks.name: Infrastructure and networks
infrastructure_and_networks.description: Built infrastructure and networked systems supporting transport, energy, water and communication.

ecosystems.name: Ecosystems
ecosystems.description: Terrestrial, freshwater and marine ecosystems and biodiversity.

forest_ecosystem.name: Forest ecosystem
forest_ecosystem.description: Terrestrial ecosystem dominated by trees and woody vegetation.

wetland_ecosystem.name: Wetland ecosystem
wetland_ecosystem.description: Ecosystem characterized by water saturation, including marshes, swamps and peatlands.

coastal_ecosystem.name: Coastal ecosystem
coastal_ecosystem.description: Ecosystem located at the interface between land and sea, including beaches, estuaries and deltas.

mangrove_ecosystem.name: Mangrove ecosystem
mangrove_ecosystem.description: Coastal ecosystem dominated by mangrove vegetation in tropical and subtropical regions.

urban_ecosystem.name: Urban ecosystem
urban_ecosystem.description: Ecosystem formed by interactions between living organisms and the built environment in urban areas.

impact.name: Impact
impact.description: Negative effects or consequences affecting human, natural or socio-technical systems.

climate_impact.name: Climate Impact
climate_impact.description: Negative consequences and damages directly or indirectly caused by climate hazards.

infrastructure_impact.name: Infrastructure Impact
infrastructure_impact.description: Impacts on infrastructure systems including physical damage, operational disruption and service failure.

infrastructure_damage.name: Infrastructure Damage
infrastructure_damage.description: Physical damage to built infrastructure including buildings, roads, bridges and utilities.

energy_security_impact.name: Energy Security Impact
energy_security_impact.description: Disruptions to energy production, transmission and distribution systems.

transportation_impact.name: Transportation Impact
transportation_impact.description: Disruptions to transportation networks including roads, railways, ports and airports.

agricultural_loss.name: Agricultural Loss
agricultural_loss.description: Losses in crop yields, livestock productivity and agricultural assets.

economic_impact.name: Economic Impact
economic_impact.description: Broader economic effects including market disruption, productivity loss and long-term economic consequences.

economic_loss.name: Economic Loss
economic_loss.description: Direct financial losses including property damage, repair costs and business interruption.

health_impact.name: Health Impact
health_impact.description: Adverse effects on physical and mental health including illness, injury and mortality.

psychological_impact.name: Psychological Impact
psychological_impact.description: Mental health effects including trauma, anxiety, stress and psychological distress.

social_impact.name: Social Impact
social_impact.description: Effects on social systems, community cohesion, equity and quality of life.

displacement_impact.name: Displacement Impact
displacement_impact.description: Forced migration, displacement and relocation of populations due to climate hazards.

food_security_impact.name: Food Security Impact
food_security_impact.description: Disruptions to food availability, access and stability leading to food insecurity.

water_security_impact.name: Water Security Impact
water_security_impact.description: Impacts on water availability, quality and access to safe drinking water.

environmental_impact.name: Environmental Impact
environmental_impact.description: Damage to natural ecosystems, biodiversity loss and degradation of ecosystem services.

biodiversity_loss.name: Biodiversity Loss
biodiversity_loss.description: Reduction in species diversity, habitat loss and ecosystem degradation.

compound_impact.name: Compound Impact
compound_impact.description: Cascading and interconnected impacts affecting multiple systems simultaneously.

outcome.name: Outcome
outcome.description: Resulting effect or consequence produced by an action, intervention or process.

adaptation_outcome.name: Adaptation Outcome
adaptation_outcome.description: Positive and measurable outcomes resulting from the implementation of climate adaptation measures.

risk_reduction.name: Risk Reduction
risk_reduction.description: Reduction in climate-related risk exposure, sensitivity or potential damages.

flood_risk_reduction.name: Flood Risk Reduction
flood_risk_reduction.description: Reduced likelihood or severity of flooding events and associated damages.

heat_stress_reduction.name: Heat Stress Reduction
heat_stress_reduction.description: Reduction of heat exposure and heat-related stress in people and urban environments.

water_retention.name: Water Retention
water_retention.description: Improved water storage, infiltration and groundwater recharge.

resilience_increase.name: Resilience Increase
resilience_increase.description: Enhanced capacity of systems, communities or ecosystems to absorb, adapt and recover from climate impacts.

ecosystem_service_enhancement.name: Ecosystem Service Enhancement
ecosystem_service_enhancement.description: Improvement of ecosystem services such as cooling, flood regulation and air purification.

health_benefit.name: Health Benefit
health_benefit.description: Improved physical and mental health outcomes and reduced health risks.

economic_benefit.name: Economic Benefit
economic_benefit.description: Avoided economic losses, cost savings and improved economic stability due to adaptation.

air_quality_improvement.name: Air Quality Improvement
air_quality_improvement.description: Reduction of air pollutants and improvement of ambient air quality.

geographic_region.name: Geographic Region
geographic_region.description: Geographic area where climate events occur

urban_area.name: Urban Area
urban_area.description: A densely built environment characterized by high population concentration, infrastructure, and economic activity.

coastal_zone.name: Coastal Zone
coastal_zone.description: A geographic area where land meets the sea, influenced by coastal processes, tides, and marine dynamics.

river_basin.name: River Basin
river_basin.description: The land area drained by a river and its tributaries, forming a connected hydrological system.

climate_region.name: Climate Region
climate_region.description: A large geographic area defined by shared climatic patterns, such as Mediterranean, Atlantic, or Continental conditions.

geographic_context.name: Geographic Context
geographic_context.description: A physical setting defined by distinctive landforms—such as islands, peninsulas, deltas, or mountains—that shape environmental and socio‑economic conditions.

world_region.name: World Region
world_region.description: A broad global area grouped by geographic, cultural, or geopolitical characteristics, such as Europe, Sub‑Saharan Africa, or South Asia.

social_group.name: Social Group
social_group.description: A set of individuals who share common characteristics, identities, or social conditions that shape their interactions, behaviors, and collective experiences within a society.

vulnerable_group.name: Vulnerable Group
vulnerable_group.description: A population with limited capacity to cope with or recover from adverse impacts due to social, economic, or environmental disadvantages.

low_income.name: Low-income Population
low_income.description: A social group with limited financial resources, often facing restricted access to services, opportunities, and climate resilience.

marginalized.name: Marginalized Community
marginalized.description: A population group experiencing social, economic, or political exclusion that reduces access to resources, rights, and decision‑making.

informal_settlement.name: Informal Settlement
informal_settlement.description: A vulnerable residential area lacking formal planning, secure tenure, or adequate services.

CAUSES.name: causes
CAUSES.description: Causal relationship where a climate hazard produces a negative impact.

ADDRESSES.name: addresses
ADDRESSES.description: Indicates that a measure is designed to mitigate an impact or manage a hazard.

PRODUCES.name: produces
PRODUCES.description: Links an adaptation measure to its intended positive result or benefit.

MITIGATES.name: mitigates
MITIGATES.description: Effectiveness relationship: the positive outcome reduces the severity of a negative impact.

BURDENS.name: burdens
BURDENS.description: Connects an impact to the social or vulnerable group that suffers the consequences.

EXPERIENCES.name: experiences
EXPERIENCES.description: Relationship between an economic sector or system and the climate impact it receives.

BENEFITS.name: benefits
BENEFITS.description: Final positive effect of an adaptation outcome on a group or sector.

OCCURS_IN.name: occurs in
OCCURS_IN.description: Spatial relationship specifically for physical events and their resulting consequences.

IS_IMPLEMENTED_IN.name: is implemented in
IS_IMPLEMENTED_IN.description: Spatial relationship for human-led actions, policies, or physical infrastructures.

IS_LOCATED_IN.name: is located in
IS_LOCATED_IN.description: Spatial relationship for the geographical position of populations or social groups.

TARGETS.name: targets
TARGETS.description: Indicates the specific population or vulnerable group that a measure intends to protect or support.

APPLIES_TO.name: applies to
APPLIES_TO.description: Connects an adaptation measure to the specific economic or functional sector where it is deployed.

CASCADES_TO.name: cascades to
CASCADES_TO.description: Transitive relationship to model risk chains and secondary impacts.

PART_OF.name: part of
PART_OF.description: Structural relationship where a smaller subsystem or component belongs to a larger system.

HAS_PART.name: has part
HAS_PART.description: Structural relationship where a larger system includes smaller subsystems or components.
